docstr: `SHIFTR` â€” Right shift ### Description `SHIFTR` returns a value corresponding to `I` with all of the bits shifted right by `SHIFT` places. If the absolute value of `SHIFT` is greater than `BIT_SIZE(I)`, the value is undefined. Bits shifted out from the right end are lost, and bits shifted in from the left end are set to 0. ### Syntax `RESULT = SHIFTR(I, SHIFT)` ### Arguments . | `SHIFT` | The type shall be `INTEGER`. ### Return value The return value is of type `INTEGER` and of the same kind as `I`. ### Standard Fortran 2008 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also SHIFTA, SHIFTL
